chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reginald Dwight Funches is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Reginald Dwight Funches was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

RE: Placement- Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mr. Salmons' predisposition investigation report concludes institutional care. Defn does not agree with recommendation. State requesting the CT adopt the recommendation. Witness Earl Salmons duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA Olsen. Cross exam by Atty Cardamone. Exam by CT. Witness excused at 9:57 am. Defn wishes to call a re-entry coordinator with DCJ; argument by Atty Cardamone. CT grants request. Witness Emily "Alyce" Koon duly sworn and testified via telephone. Direct exam by Atty Cardamone. Cross exam by ADA Olsen. Witness excused at 10:10 am. Argument by ADA Olsen; State request institutional care. Argument by Atty Cardamone; defn request conditional release.  CT makes findings and orders institutional care. Argument by Atty Cardamone; RE: Involuntary Medications. CT makes findings and denies order to treat. CT signs order for placment f/w. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are stipulating to NGI and a 3ys commitment. Argument by Atty Cardamone. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 3. State moves to dismiss cts 1 and 4. Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1 and 4. State believes there is a factual basis for the CT to find NGI. Atty Cardamone believes defn is competent. CT orders defn committed and orders predisposition report.
